title: For those who want to improve on CSing
body: Hey guys, as a Diamond player, I find this really helpful for practicing CSing, so if you're willing to take the time to practice, I would suggest using these tips. Good luck in the fields of justice! http://i.imgur.com/U0PCCY1.png

Minions spawn at 1:30. Takes them for 14 secs to get to the middle of mid lane. 32 seconds for bot and top lane. They spawn every 30 seconds. With that, every 3rd wave will have a seige minion, so it'll be 7 minions total instead of 6. **The 18th wave technically spawns at 10 minute mark.** It'll arrive at lane by 10:15 - 10:30. So by 10:30, this is where you're CSing should be around, **with the 18th wave**:

* 114 CS = 100%
* 112 CS = 98%
* 110 CS = 96%
* 108 = 95%
* 106 = 93%
* 104 = 91%
* 103 = 90%

I'm tired of these lame posts trying to tell you to cs better, yea the first 10 minutes are important if no one is fighting because **YOU CAN'T KILL ANYONE,** so what do you do instead? Farm it up! Tell me what the point of trying to farm an extra 20 cs is rather than trying to crush your lane?  Yea, it's 1 more kill than them but guess what if your lane's even, IT'S EVEN: FIX IT. Here's why you end up with more cs, past the 5-10 minute mark: Fear, they fear you and will not dare to push past where their closest tower is (or was >:D); and if you're consistently pushed it means you want to get ganked and because you're so far ahead because they fear you, they try to help with that gank. Well guess what happens next: you double kill the enemy bot lane because counter ganks and cleaning up is better than diving them under tower, and jungler runs away as if he just baited his bot lane into feeding... because he did. Crush your lane then crush the jungler, then crush them 5v5. Oh hey look i have 100 cs more than my laner and 10 kills up!

If you're not trying to kill your laner, are you even playing to win?  Why not try to kill them? I mean think about it, do you know how easy it is to die because they decided to make a play before you did? "Welp now me and my support are dead varus/cait/ez is 4-0 and we're both sitting at 0-2 BUT I'M 40 CS AHEAD!!!" Too bad you fed them your lead >:) 

DON'T PLAY PASSIVE, and don't fight them in large minion waves.

hmmm well there's no actual guide for that and it's not in the one I posted above as far as I know, but I will attempt to explain it. Try last hitting when the minion is **as low as possible**. This will ensure that you will get the minion. Also watch your minion auto attacks, because sometimes those screw up your last hitting. If there are two low minions but one isn't getting attacked by minions, hit the other one because the one that isn't being attacked will not die and you will not miss it. Try to find out the damage minions do so you'll know to last hit after how many minion autos. Ranged minions do more damage and Melee minions do less but are tankier. Therefore, to freeze a lane, kill the melee minions first, to push a lane, kill the ranged minions first so they don't have as much damage kill your minions.
